meanings.definition: To write or type out something in full.
meanings.sent1: I will transcribe the letter for you.
meanings.sent2: She had to transcribe the notes from the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to transcribe the teacher's words but kept making mistakes.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers moved quickly to transcribe the song lyrics onto paper.
meanings.sent5: He used a special machine to transcribe the ancient text accurately.

meanings.definition: To convert spoken language into written form.
meanings.sent1: The secretary will transcribe the dictation from the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The court reporter had to transcribe every word spoken during the trial.
meanings.sent3: The parrot tried to transcribe the owner's words but ended up mixing them up.
meanings.sent4: She could easily transcribe the foreign language into English.
meanings.sent5: The software can transcribe the audio file into text with high accuracy.

meanings.definition: To make a written or printed copy of something.
meanings.sent1: I will transcribe the document for you.
meanings.sent2: The librarian needed to transcribe the old manuscript to preserve it.
meanings.sent3: The copier machine can transcribe multiple copies in a short time.
meanings.sent4: She will transcribe the painting onto canvas for the art exhibit.
meanings.sent5: The scribe would transcribe the important scrolls for the king.
